item.title: Genshin Impact Version Luna IV Arrives Later This Month
item.content:encoded:
Genshin Impact Version Luna IV is scheduled to arrive in just a couple of weeks, developer and publisher HoYoverse has announced, and it'll bring a brand new character when it does, as well as the "dramatic climax" for the game's Nod-Krai storyline and more.

Per a press release, Version Luna IV will launch across all platforms on January 14th, so you've got about twelve days (at time of writing) to catch up with Genshin Impact before the latest update drops.

When Version Luna IV is released, it'll bring the climax of the Nod-Krai narrative arc, which will see you moving toward "a decisive confrontation with Il Dottore" in his "twisted domain where the rules of reality are upended".

This latest update also comes complete with a whopping three characters for you to get to grips with, beginning with the Moon Maiden Columbina Hyposelenia, a 5-star Hydro Catalyst user who specializes in "potent support centered around Lunar Reactions". She's a skilled all-rounder who'll be great for your team.

Joining her are 5-star Geo Sword user Zibai, "also known as the White Horse Adeptus in Liyue's books and folktales". As you can imagine from her choice of weapon, Zibai is an offense-focused character who's capable of dealing big damage through "relentless assaults".

The final new character in Genshin Impact Version Luna IV is Illuga, a 4-star Polearm user who "battles alongside a messenger bird".

These three characters will be available at various points throughout Version Luna IV's update cycle, and they'll join reruns of Ineffa and Neuvillette, with the latter's new outfit also becoming available in the shop "for a limited time".

As usual, HoYoverse has also revealed three new codes you can use to get yourself some free stuff. Here they are!

  • ComeNightorDay - 100 Primogems, 10 Mystic Enhancement Ore
  • Zibai0515 - 100 Primogems, 5 Hero's Wit
  • GallopYeah - 100 Primogems, 50,000 Mora

Genshin Impact is available to play for free right now on PC, PlayStation (although PS4 support is ending soon), Xbox Series X|S, and mobile devices. Update Luna IV launches on January 15th.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
